data.text: @Poopoolala79 You stay home the full 14 days (or get sent to a CIF).
@tripperhead What difference if you’re not fully vaccinated but test neg on day 6&7?
@xennialmatt @MokJonathan @tripperhead @webbhk Quite possible. Because the rest of the world wants to return to normal, but HK wants to return to zero.
@KentonMcElhone @tripperhead Singapore hasn't had a day with more than 20 covid deaths

@elikonvitz @MokJonathan @tripperhead @webbhk I’d put money on it that the isolation for positive cases will go back to 14 days (at least) after this wave gets back close to zero and then align further with Mainland. This is a temporary change because they have no choice, but because change in rationale.
@tripperhead I hope I won’t get prosecuted for leaving home quarantine early even tho I tested negative on the 7th day.

@MokJonathan @tripperhead …that said, @webbhk just pointed out that an inbound traveller who tests positive could be released after 7 days, but a negative test would still require 14 days in hotel quarantine. Gloriously bonkers… Dare I allow myself a glimmer of hope for travel?

@MokJonathan @tripperhead By your and my logic, yes. But the stated goal remains zero covid and opening up to the mainland. So (unless the political directive changes) as this wave ends, govt will likely want to have kept inbound quarantine - and to go back to isolating every case too.
@tripperhead I have no idea anymore what to do when..
